deIdi2b2.TEXT:
Record date: 2069-10-22
EDVISIT^63107921^RILEY, MARY^10/22/2069^VOLLMER, NATHAN
Seen by Dr. Thrasher and seen and examined by me.
CHIEF COMPLAINT: Shortness of breath.
Currently, being admitted to Internal Medicine.
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: This 66-year-old woman with a
significant medical history including hypothyroidism, history of
high cholesterol, diabetes type 1, hypertension and history of
myocardial infarction in the past and status post cholecystectomy
who presents now with palpitations and shortness of breath. Her
complaint is that for the last 5 days, she has had this bilateral
neck pain with shortness of breath. She had no significant chest
pain, but complaining of dull achy pain and dull achy sensation
throughout her throat. She felt some sensation of her heart
racing with her neck pain. Mild headache. No fevers however.
She has had no diaphoresis or nausea and vomiting. Blood
pressure initially was 212/76. Her blood pressure has since then
came down nicely, now is 161/72 and the rest of her vital signs
are normal.
MEDICATIONS: As would be expected, she is on multiple
medications, which includes captopril, levothyroxine, clonidine
and aspirin as well as nitrates and insulin as well as albuterol
and Lipitor.
REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: She has had no recent pneumonia or fevers.
Her shortness of breath is both at rest and with some exertion.
Again, she had no significant or definitive chest pain per se but
gives history of some neck pain for the last 5 days with some
nausea. Her palpitations have been intermittent.
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION: She is comfortable. Her HEENT exam is
normal. Her neck is supple without any JVP. No bruits heard on
neck exam. Clear lungs with normal breath sounds. No signs of
failure, no rales. Cardiac exam: Regular rate and rhythm. No
murmurs and no rubs. Benign abdomen with normal bowel sounds.
Soft, without any tenderness. Extremities are normal without any
pedal edema. Rest of her exam is benign.
LABORATORY DATA: Chest x-ray was normal without any evidence of
failure or any acute process. EKG, some nonspecific T-wave
changes when compared with previous EKGs, there are no new
changes. Her urinalysis is negative. Troponin and CK are
normal. The rest of her labs are all benign.
ASSESSMENT: A 66-year-old female with shortness of breath,
palpitations and 5-day history of neck pain. Initially
hypertensive but blood pressure has normalized nicely. No
widened mediastinum on chest x-ray. No discrepancy in terms of
her blood pressure in both upper extremities. Cardiac markers
are flat and EKG is unremarkable.
EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT COURSE: Treated with aspirin, nitroglycerin
and beta-blocker in the ED. She is currently symptom free. She
was also given some morphine sulfate for her pain. She needs to
******** Not reviewed by Attending Physician ********
DIAGNOSIS: Palpitations with shortness of breath or neck pain,
possible angina.
DISPOSITION: The patient admitted in stable condition.
______________________________
VOLLMER, NATHAN M.D.
D: 10/22/69
T: 10/22/69
Dictated By: VOLLMER, NATHAN
